intro: [WRONG START] Cereus landbeckii var. philippii, commonly known as the Philippine star cactus, is a species native to the Philippines. It is a flowering cactus that produces striking white or yellow flowers during the night. The plant has a cylindrical stem with prominent areoles and spines, typical of the Cactaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and nocturnal blooming habit, it is a popular choice for collectors and horticultural enthusiasts.
